job_description: Data Scientist - job post COMTEC 26 reviews Plano, TX • Hybrid remote $60 - $62 an hour -  Contract Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary $60 - $62 an hour Job Type Contract Role : CW Data Scientist (1169850)- TFS Location : 6565 Headquarters Dr, Plano, TX Duration : 12 Months · Description: Reason for contingent headcount? o Document models to meet Enterprise Risk’s model governance requirements What are the key objectives for this resource (project summary)? o Document new and existing models to meet model governance requirements. Revise and reimplement modeling scripts to assess model performance post-implementation impact. What are the Roles and Responsibilities of this role? o The primary responsibility of this role is to document new and existing models to meet model governance standards as required by Enterprise Risk Management. Time permitting some scripts also need revision to assess post-implementation model performance. o The analyst will need to understand how Generalized Linear Models are used in the rate setting process via estimation of claim frequency and severity created for Vehicle Service Contracts and Tire & Wheel protection products. o Specific responsibilities include documenting: 1) the queries and scripts that extract and link data from company systems, 2) manipulate and clean the results, 3) model results and selected outcomes clearly describing each step of the process. What specific TFS departments will they interact with? o Actuarial Science, Data Science, Enterprise Risk How long is this project (please be specific)? Six months List the position Requirements: A bachelor’s degree in a heavily analytical discipline and demonstrated experience in developing statistical models. An ability to read ‘R’ scripts used to develop statistical models. Coordinate with Actuarial Science team members to provide updates and adhere to work within the team’s existing practices and standards. · · Requirements: Must Haves: o Hands on data extraction and data wrangling from internal and external systems using SAS, SQL, Python, R, etc. o Analysis and model building experience using advanced analytics tools and techniques using statistical software packages like SAS, Python, R, etc. o Attend and participate (where appropriate) in various project planning and prioritization sessions. o 3-5 yrs. of relevant experience RM Notes: o Looking for a Data scientist with insurance/finance domain o Expertise in building statistical modeling, someone who has documented the same o A Master’s or Ph.D. in a heavily analytical discipline with some experience can be considered o This is a Hybrid position, Can consider someone who is remote – locals will be given first preference Preferred/ Nice-to-haves: o A Master’s or Ph.D. in a heavily analytical discipline with some experience o Advanced hands-on experience with tools such as Python (NumPy/Pandas), scikit-learn, R, and/or SAS. o Develop, manage and deploy analytic solutions using statistical software packages like SAS, R, Python, etc. o Experience in using a variety of statistical and machine learning techniques to solve problems. o Exposure and familiarity with topics like Logistic Regression, Time Series Analysis, Experimental Design, Generalized Linear Models, Mixed Modeling, Multivariate Statistics, Large-Scale Predictive Modeling, CHAID/decision trees, Gradient Boosted Trees, Random Forests, and Neural Networks. Job Type: Contract Pay: $60.00 - $62.00 per hour Schedule: Monday to Friday Application Question(s): Are you willing to work on W2 / This is a hybrid position are you willing to work ? Education: Bachelor's (Preferred) Experience: SQL: 5 years (Required) Data Scientist: 5 years (Required) Python/R: 6 years (Required) Insurance/Accounting/finance: 4 years (Required) SAS: 5 years (Required) Work Location: In person If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.
